paragraph.heading: 1Generating libraries
paragraph.paragraph: There are two main types of libraries in Eiffel: precompiled Eiffel libraries and C libraries. Both kinds of libraries can be created via EiffelStudio. The former can only be used in Eiffel projects, C libraries can be used either in Eiffel programs, or in standard C programs.
To generate an Eiffel precompiled library:

list.item: Select the Precompilation Wizard in the Toolsmenu and follow the instructions,
Select the Ace file of the library you want to precompile,
Give a location where to put the precompiled library,
the Compile the generated project checkbox in the next dialog:
Choose Precompile in the Project menu.

paragraph.paragraph: To generate a dynamically linked C library using Eiffel code:

list.item:
Generate a definition file for this library, via the
/tools/eiffelstudio/reference/30_compiler/40_dynamic_library_generation/10_dynamic_library_builder.xml Dynamic library Builder ,
In the Advanced tab, check Shared library definition,
Enter the name of the definition you created in the first step(including the path if necessary),

paragraph.paragraph: The generated C library should be located in the EIFGEN|W_code directory in the directory of your project.
To generate a C library from a C compiler, please refer to the documentation of your C compiler.
